items.title: Why Are Rates Rising Faster at Investor-owned Utilities than at Public Utilities?
items.description: Electricity rates are on the rise across the country, but nowhere has the increase been more precipitous than in California, where average residential rates surged 47 percent from 2019 to 2023, and are now twice as high as the national average. Experts point to increased utility spending on wildfire safety and recovery measures, distribution infrastructure […]

items.description: For generations, West Hawaii’s picturesque coastlines have been a gathering place for fishing, swimming and ceremony. items.title: Amid National Wolf Debate, California Kills Four of the Predators After ‘Unprecedented’ Livestock Attacks
items.description: Around 14 years ago, a lone gray wolf crossed the border from Oregon into California, marking the start of a slow return of the iconic, endangered predator to the Golden State, where it had been fully eradicated in the 1920s. items.title: New UN Report Warns of Lagging Climate Action
items.description: A new emissions gap report released by the United Nations Environment Programme suggests that a decade of global climate policy under the Paris Agreement has reduced the projected maximum global warming for this century to less than 3 degrees Celsius for the first time.  The ambitious Paris Agreement “helped steer countries’ policies and public expectations,” […]

items.title: Federal Courts Divided, So Far, on Trump’s Environmental Retreat
items.description: In President Donald Trump’s first term, the federal courts helped put the brakes on his administration’s retreat on environmental protection. Nine months into the second Trump term, the courts appear divided on whether to allow the administration’s far more aggressive dismantling of policy on climate change, clean energy and environmental justice. items.title: Trump 2.0 Environmental Case Scorecard
items.description: From the day he began his second term in January 2025, President Donald Trump and his administration have embarked on an unprecedented effort to upend U.S. environmental protection law and end policy to address the climate crisis. items.title: ‘Forever Chemicals’ Represent New Environmental Threat for Florida’s Fragile Everglades
items.description: A dozen different “forever chemicals” linked with cancer and other human health problems have been detected in the Everglades, Florida’s most important freshwater resource, responsible for the drinking water of millions in the state, according to new research. It is the first time PFAS, or perfluoroalkyl and polyfluoroalkyl substances, have been measured on the Everglades […]

items.title: ‘Burning Money’: Dept. of Energy Directs $100 Million to Modernize Declining Coal Plants
